intro: Androsiphonia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flower heads and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in saline and sandy soils. Androsiphonia species are often found in the Mediterranean region and along the Atlantic coast. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to coastal ecosystems.
